column1: After a normal re-entry, the capsule was opened and the crew was found dead.
Patsayev's ashes were inurned in the Kremlin Wall on the Red Square in Moscow.
He was posthumously awarded the title of Hero of the Soviet Union, the Order of Lenin and the title of Pilot-Cosmonaut of the USSR.
An account of Patsayev's life and space career appears in the 2003 book "Fallen Astronauts" by Colin Burgess.
